SENT.plain: We examined the effect of deferasirox (DFX) on CD34+ hematopoietic progenitors from MDS patients
Progressive, dose-dependent suppression of MDS progenitor proliferation in culture was observed with DFX concentrations ranging from 5 μM to 20 μM
This effect was more pronounced in MDS compared to CD34+ progenitors isolated from umbilical cord blood or normal peripheral blood
There was reduced viability of MDS progenitors but not normal progenitors at 20 μM DFX which increased with duration of exposure
Exposure to 20 μM DFX for 14 days markedly suppressed colony growth of MDS progenitors
Reactive oxygen species levels were elevated above control at concentrations of DFX above 5 μM
We conclude that exposure to DFX results in dose-dependent inhibition of proliferation, and survival in MDS progenitors
